OS.NAME: EN_VL_WIN2000_ADV_SP4
OS.DESCRIPTION: Windows 2000 Advance Server w/ SP4 (Volume License)

OS.NAME: EN_VL_WINXP_PRO_SP2
OS.DESCRIPTION: Windows XP Professional w/ SP2 (Volume License)

OS.NAME: EN_VL_WIN2003_WEB_SP1
OS.DESCRIPTION: Windows 2003 Server: Web Edition w/ SP1 (Volume License)

OS.NAME: EN_VL_WIN2003_STD_SP1
OS.DESCRIPTION: Windows 2003 Server: Standard Edition w/ SP1 (Volume License)

OS.NAME: EN_VL_WIN2003_ENT_SP1
OS.DESCRIPTION: Windows 2003 Server: Enterprise Edition w/ SP1 (Volume License)

APPSRV_CONSOLE.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the Application Server Console

ASPNET.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the ASP.NET Web development platform

BITSSERVEREXTENSIONSISAPI.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install Internet Server Application Programming Interface (ISAPI) for Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) server extensions on client computers

BITSSERVEREXTENSIONSMANAGER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in, administrative Application Programming Interfaces (APIs), and Active Directory Service Interfaces (ADSI) extensions for Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) server extensions

CERTSRV_CLIENT.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Web client components of the Certificate Services feature

CERTSRV_SERVER.DESCRIPTION: Installs the server components of the Certificate Services features

CHARMAP.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Character Map program that inserts symbols and characters into documents

CLIPBOOK.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the clipboard viewer

CLUSTER.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Cluster service Node and Administration components

COMPLUSNETWORK.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to enable network COM+ access

DESKPAPER.DESCRIPTION: Installs desktop wallpaper on your computer desktop

DTCNETWORK.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to enable Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator (DTC) network access

FP_VDIR_DEPLOY.DESCRIPTION: Installs Visual InterDev RAD Remote Deployment Support

IEACCESS.DESCRIPTION: Installs visible entry points (shortcuts) to Internet Explorer

IIS_ASP.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install Active Server Pages for Internet Information Services (IIS)

IIS_COMMON.DESCRIPTION: Installs the common set of files needed by IIS

IIS_HTMLA.DESCRIPTION: Installs the HTML-based administration tools for IIS

IIS_INETMGR.DESCRIPTION: Installs the MMC-based administration tools for IIS

IIS_INTERNETDATACONNECTOR.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the Internet Data Connector

IIS_NNTP.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Network News Transfer Protocol (NNTP) service

IIS_NNTP_DOCS.DESCRIPTION: Installs the documentation for the NNTP service

IIS_SERVERSIDEINCLUDES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install Server-Side Includes

IIS_SMTP.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) service

IIS_SMTP_DOCS.DESCRIPTION: Installs documentation for the SMTP service

IIS_WEBADMIN.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the Web UI for Web server administration (Remote Administration Tools)

IIS_WEBDAV.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install WebDAV Publishing

IIS_WWW.DESCRIPTION: Installs the World Wide Web (WWW) service

IIS_WWW_VDIR_PRINTERS.DESCRIPTION: Installs Web printing components in a virtual directory

IIS_WWW_VDIR_SCRIPTS.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to create the optional scripts directory on the default Web site

IIS_WWW_VDIR_TERMINALSERVICES.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Terminal Services ActiveX client in a virtual directory

INETPRINT.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install Internet Printing

LICENSESERVER.DESCRIPTION: Turns Terminal Services licensing on or off

MOUSEPOINT.DESCRIPTION: Installs all the available mouse pointers that ship with Windows

MSMQ.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Message Queuing Services (MSMQ) components

MSMQ_ADINTEGRATED.DESCRIPTION: Integrates Message Queuing (also known as MSMQ) with Active Directory if the computer belongs to a domain

MSMQ_CORE.DESCRIPTION: Performs general tasks required to setup the Message Queuing components

MSMQ_HTTPSUPPORT.DESCRIPTION: Enables the sending and receiving of messages using the HTTP protocol

MSMQ_LOCALSTORAGE.DESCRIPTION: Stores messages locally, so the computer can send and receive messages even when it is not connected to a network

MSMQ_MQDSSERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Provides access to Active Directory and site recognition for downstream clients

MSMQ_TRIGGERSSERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Associates the arrival of incoming messages at a queue with functionality in a Component Object Model (COM) component or a stand-alone executable program

NETCIS.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Microsoft COM Internet Services

OEACCESS.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install visible entry points to Outlook Express

POP3ADMIN.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the optional MMC-component for the POP3 Admin on the computer

POP3SERVICE.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the main POP3 service on the computer

POP3SRV.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the root POP3 component on the computer

ROOTAUTOUPDATE.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to turn on the Optional Components Manager (OCM) Update Root Certificates

RSTORAGE.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Remote Storage Service feature that allow the use of tape libraries as extensions of NTFS volumes

TERMINALSERVER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install Terminal Server (Terminal Services for multiple users) on the computer

TSCLIENTS.DESCRIPTION: Installs the files (approximately 10 MB) required to create Terminal Services client disks

TSWEBCLIENT.DESCRIPTION: Installs the ActiveX control and sample pages for hosting Terminal Services client connections over the Web

WBEMSNMP.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the WMI SNMP Provider components

WMACCESS.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install visible entry points to Windows Messenger

WMPOCM.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install visible entry points to Windows Media Player

WMS.DESCRIPTION: Must be ON to install either of the Windows Media Services components: administrative or server

WMS_ADMIN.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Windows Media Services administrative components

WMS_ADMIN_ASP.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Windows Media Services Web-based administrative components

WMS_ADMIN_MMC.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Windows Media Services MMC-based administrative components

WMS_ISAPI.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the Windows Media Services Multicast and Advertisement Logging Agent components

WMS_SERVER.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Windows Media Services server components

ZONEGAMES.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Microsoft Gaming Zone Internet games

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Required Arguements for the Detached Program

DETACHEDPROGRAM.DESCRIPTION: A program that runs concurently with setup.exe

ACS.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that QoS Admission Control Service be installed

BEACON.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install or remove the beacon client

DHCPSERVER.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that DHCP Server be installed

IAS.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Internet Authentication Services (IAS) and creates a shortcut to the IAS MMC snap-in under the Administrative Tools section of the Start menu

ILS.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that the Internet Location Service (ILS) be installed

LPDSVC.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that Print Services for UNIX be installed

MACPRINT.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that Print Services for Macintosh be installed

MACSVC.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that Services for Macintosh (SFM) be installed

NETCM.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Microsoft Connection Manager Administration Kit and Phone Book Service

NETMONTOOLS.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that Network Monitor tools be installed

SIMPTCP.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that Simple TCP/IP Services be installed

DEFAULTSTARTPANELOFF.DESCRIPTION: Uses the classic Windows Start menu instead of the Windows XP Start menu

DEFAULTTHEMESOFF.DESCRIPTION: Uses the classic Windows visual style instead of the default Windows XP visual style

LICENSINGMODE.DESCRIPTION: Configures how Terminal Services manages its CALs: perseat|persession

PERMISSIONSSETTING.DESCRIPTION: Used by administrators to choose the security mode for Terminal Server users during terminal server sessions

AUTOCONFIG.DESCRIPTION: Whether to autoconfigure browser from a server

AUTOCONFIGJSURL.DESCRIPTION: URL of Javascript used to autoconfigure proxy settings

AUTOCONFIGURL.DESCRIPTION: URL of INS File used to autoconfigure proxy settings

APPSRV_CONSOLE.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install the Application Server Console

DESKPAPER.DESCRIPTION: Installs desktop wallpaper on your computer desktop

MOUSEPOINT.DESCRIPTION: Installs all the available mouse pointers that ship with Windows

OEACCESS.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to install visible entry points to Outlook Express

ROOTAUTOUPDATE.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to turn on the Optional Components Manager (OCM) Update Root Certificates

TSCLIENTS.DESCRIPTION: Installs the files (approximately 10 MB) required to create Terminal Services client disks

ZONEGAMES.DESCRIPTION: Installs the Microsoft Gaming Zone Internet games
